title: geth crashes just when starting -  SIGSEGV: segmentation violation code=0x1 addr=0x0 pc=0x7fff2e297548
body:
#### System information

Go Version: 
`go version go1.10 darwin/amd64`

Geth version:
```
Version: 1.8.2-stable
Architecture: amd64
Protocol Versions: [63 62]
Network Id: 1
Go Version: go1.10
Operating System: darwin
GOPATH=
GOROOT=/usr/local/opt/go/libexec
```

OS & Version: OSX
```
uname -a result
Darwin xxxxxxx.local 17.4.0 Darwin Kernel Version 17.4.0: Sun Dec 17 09:19:54 PST 2017; root:xnu-4570.41.2~1/RELEASE_X86_64 x86_64
```


#### Expected behaviour
Geth should start without any problem.
Just to clarify things I tough that the problem was related with the OS thinking that probably some particular internal engine was involved on this failure so I performed a CLEAN new fresh install (meaning by that deletion of the HDD partition, reformat to APFS, installation from an USB)

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
I simply tried on both ways
```
1. - Installed go on the newest version by the pkg file
2.- Installed git client 
3.- Cloned go-ethereum 
4.- Performed the make instruction inside the clone
5.- Tried to execute the geth command on the compiled code
6.- Error was thrown
```
The other one:
```
1. - Installed homebrew
2.- Installed ethereum with brew instruction
3.- Tried to execute the geth command on the compiled code
4.- Error was thrown
```

Any help will be highly appreciated!
Thanks!
I can't reproduce this issue. Is this still happening for you?
Closing because this is being tracked in https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/15100
